summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for July 31, 2019. It details inmate movements, staff assignments, and operational notes, including the placement of inmate #89380-053 (Jeffrey Epstein) on a dry cell after he was observed with a cellphone and attempted to conceal it. The report also lists other inmates placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and notes staff shortages.

events.title: Epstein Cellphone Incident and Dry Cell Placement
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#89380-053) was observed by the Sanitation Officer talking on a cellphone. As his cell door was being unlocked, he inserted the cellphone into his anus. He was subsequently placed on a 'Dry Cell' for monitoring.

events.title: Epstein Moved to Special Housing Unit
events.description: Later during the Evening Watch Shift, inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#89380-053) was removed from the Dry Cell and placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), with a notation 'Code #108/Pend. FBI Ref.'

events.title: Multiple Inmates Placed in SHU
events.description: Several other inmates were placed on the Special Housing Unit during the Day Watch Shift, including inmates with pending SIS (Special Investigative Supervisor) investigations or specific behavioral codes.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #89380-053) was caught with a contraband cellphone and attempted to conceal it internally on July 31, 2019, leading to his placement in a dry cell.
Epstein's SHU placement was marked with 'Code #108' and 'Pend. FBI Ref.', indicating a pending FBI reference or investigation.
The MCC New York facility reported staff shortages affecting correctional assignments in units like SHU #4, 10-South #2, and 11-South.
The document is an official internal government memorandum detailing the daily operations and inmate status at the MCC on the day of a significant incident involving Epstein.
Other inmates were also placed in the SHU, and one inmate was at a local hospital under USMS guard, showing varied inmate statuses and security levels.
